definition: bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam

sentences.english: Fang and Big Pang are divine birds which outstanding appearance in the Libai's poem.
sentences.chinese: 凤和大鹏是李白诗中突出的神鸟意象。

sentences.english: The phoenix is a divine bird in Chinese ancient legend.
sentences.chinese: 凤是中国古代传说中的神鸟。

sentences.english: Is this the fabled Holy Bird flying to this treasure-ground to make its presence felt?
sentences.chinese: 难道这是传说中的神鸟，飞到这块宝地显圣来了？

sentences.english: Landry is called God Bird, as he always flies high to get a slam dunk.
sentences.chinese: 兰德里叫神鸟，因为他总是能飞得很高扣篮。

sentences.english: Besides, they are regarded as divine birds and as the ever incarnation of Buddha.
sentences.chinese: 佛经中，它被视为神鸟，佛曾化身为鹦鹉。

definition: three-legged Golden Crow that lives in the sun (in northeast Asian and Chinese mythology)/Korean: samjog'o
three-legged Golden Crow that lives in the sun (in northeast Asian and Chinese mythology)/Korean: samjog'o
Golden Crow/the sun/the three-legged golden crow that lives in the sun
Fenghuang county in Xiangxi Tujia and Miao autonomous prefecture 湘西土家族苗族自治州[Xiang1 xi1 Tu3 jia1 zu2 Miao2 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1]
Vermilion Bird (the seven mansions of the south sky)
luan and phoenix/husband and wife/virtuous person/sovereign/belle

four divinities/four divine emperors/four mythical creatures symbolic of prosperity and longevity, namely the phoenix 鳳|凤[feng4], turtle 龜|龟[gui1], dragon 龍|龙[long2] and Chinese unicorn 麒麟[qi2 lin2]/also 四象[si4 xiang4], the four division of the sky
kun 鯤|鲲[kun1] and peng 鵬|鹏[Peng2], mythological beasts/peng, a gigantic bird transformed from the kun
(bird species of China) golden eagle (Aquila chrysaetos)
